protocol.description:
An interface to capture surfaces in an efficient way. Overall usage:
1.) client registers with zwlr_screencontent_manager 2.) server sends client info about surfaces via "receive_surface_info" 3.) client subscribes to capture a surface via the "capture" request 4.) server sends client events via the "zwlr_screencontent_frame" interface 5.) client finishes and informs server via the "destroy" event

interface.name: zwlr_screencontent_frame
interface.description:
This object represents a frame which is ready to have its resources fetched and used.
The receive callback shall be called first, followed by either the "receive_object" callback once per object or the "receive_layer" callback, once per layer. The "receive_plane" callback shall only be called after the "receive_layer" callback corresponding to the layer the plane belongs to has been called. Finally, the "ready" event is called to indicate that all the data has been made available for readout, as well as the time at which presentation happened at. The ownership of the frame is passed to the client, who's responsible for destroying it once ready. The data the API describes has been based off of what VASurfaceAttribExternalBuffers contains. All frames are read-only and may not be written into or altered.

enum.name: frame_flags
enum.description: Special flags that must be respected by the client. Transient frames indicate short lifetime frames (such as swapchain images from external clients). Clients are advised to copy them and do all processing outside of the "ready" event.

event.name: receive
event.description: Main callback supplying the client with information about the frame, as well as an object to serve as context for destruction. Always called first before any other events.

arg.name: scale
arg.summary: current scaling factor of the client

arg.name: num_objects
arg.summary: indicates how many objects (FDs) the frame has (max 4)

arg.name: num_layers
arg.summary: indicates how many layers the frame has (max 4)

event.name: receive_object
event.description: Callback which serves to supply the client with the file descriptors containing the data for each object. The amount of data in each FD can be inferred via lseek(). Will be called after the main receive event, once per object.

event.name: receive_layer
event.description: Callback which serves to supply the client with information on what's contained in each file descriptor and how its laid out. Will be called after the main receive event, once per layer.

arg.name: num_planes
arg.summary: number of planes in the current layer (max 4)

event.name: receive_plane
event.description: Callback which supplies the client with plane information for each layer.

arg.name: object_index
arg.summary: index of the object the plane applies to

arg.name: offset
arg.summary: starting point for the data in the object's fd

event.name: ready

description.summary: indicates frame is available for reading

event.description: Called as soon as the frame is presented, indicating it is available for reading.

event.name: abort

description.summary: indicates the frame is no longer valid

event.description: If the frame is no longer valid after the "receive" event has been called, this callback will be used to inform the client to scrap the frame. The client can register to receive another frame callback here in case capturing becomes possible again.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: delete this object, used or not

request.description: Unreferences the frame, allowing it to be reused. Must be called as soon as its no longer used.

interface.name: zwlr_screencontent_manager

description.summary: manager to inform clients and begin capturing

interface.description: This object is a manager which informs clients about capturable windows and is able to create callbacks from which to begin to receive content from. The "title" argument in the "receive_surface_info" event shall be used to provide a user-readable identifier such as a window title or program name. To begin capturing, use the "capture" request with an ID. Additionally, to capture a cursor surface, use the "cursor" argument with a non-zero value. If a client has no cursor or cursor is unable to be captured, the "capture" request shall return NULL. The client can specify which frame type would be preferred using the "type" argument. If a compositor is unable to provide frames with a given type, NULL shall be returned. The client is welcome to retry with another frame type.

entry.name: byte_buffer
entry.summary: file descriptors to hold mappable linear memfd buffers

entry.name: dma_buf
entry.summary: file descriptors to contain valid dmabuf objects

event.name: receive_surface_info
event.description: This will be called whenever a surface that's able to be captured appears.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: an identifier to create a context

request.name: capture
request.description: Request to start capturing from a surface with a given id.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: an identifier to create a context

arg.name: type
arg.summary: indicates the type of frame preferred
